# init(frame:style:)

**Initializer**

Creates and returns a table view with the specified frame and style.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor init(frame: CGRect, style: UITableView.Style)
```

## Parameters

- **frame**: A rectangle specifying the initial location and size of the table view in its superview’s coordinates. The frame of the table view changes as table cells are added and deleted.
- **style**: A constant that specifies the style of the table view. For a list of valid styles, see [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/Style-swift.enum].

## Return Value

Returns an initialized [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView] object.

## Discussion

You must specify the style of a table view when you create it, and you can’t change that style later. If you initialize the table view with the [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/releasenotes/iPhone/RN-iPhoneSDK/index.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40007428-CH1-SW18] method [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView/init(frame:)], the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/Style-swift.enum/plain] style is used as a default.

## Creating a table view

- **init(coder:)**: Creates a table view object from data in an unarchiver.
